name: General Knowledge
description: A diverse quiz testing your knowledge on various topics.

questions.title: What is the capital of France?
Who wrote '1984'?
What is the largest planet in our solar system?
In what year did the Titanic sink?
Which element has the chemical symbol 'O'?
Who painted the Mona Lisa?
What is the smallest country in the world?
Which ocean is the largest?
What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
Which country is known as the Land of the Rising Sun?

name: Geography
description: Test your knowledge of world geography.

questions.title: Which country has the largest population?
What is the capital of Canada?
Which desert is the largest in the world?
Which river is the longest in the world?
Which country is known as the Land of the Midnight Sun?
Which is the smallest country in Africa?
Which mountain is the highest in the world?
Which country has the most official languages?
Which ocean is the smallest?
Which country is the largest by land area?

name: Biology
description: Test your knowledge of the natural world and living organisms.

questions.title: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
Which blood cells help fight infections?
What is the main gas responsible for global warming?
Which organ filters blood in the human body?
What is the largest organ in the human body?
Which macromolecule is the main source of energy for the body?
Which part of the brain controls balance and coordination?
Which blood type is known as the universal donor?
Which process do plants use to make food?
What is the basic unit of life?

name: Netflix
description: Test your knowledge of popular Netflix shows and movies.

questions.title: In 'Stranger Things', what is Eleven's real name?

Which animated Netflix series features a yellow family?

In 'Bridgerton', which family is the story centered around?
Which series features the character Joe Goldberg?

name: Philosophy
description: Challenge your understanding of philosophy, thinkers, and ideas.

questions.title: Who wrote 'The Republic'?
Which philosopher is famous for the quote 'I think, therefore I am'?
Existentialism is most closely associated with which thinker?
Who is considered the father of modern political philosophy?
Which philosopher wrote 'Thus Spoke Zarathustra'?
Which school of thought believes knowledge comes primarily from sensory experience?
Who introduced the concept of the 'categorical imperative'?
What does 'tabula rasa' mean in philosophy?
Who wrote 'Meditations'?
Which philosopher is associated with 'will to power'?

name: Sharks
description: Test your knowledge of shark species, behavior, and biology.

questions.title: Which species is known as the largest shark?
Which sense is especially well-developed in sharks?
What is the term for sharks giving birth to live young?
Which shark species is considered the fastest swimmer?
Which sense allows sharks to detect electrical fields?
Which shark is known for its distinctive hammer-shaped head?
What is the main diet of a Whale Shark?
Which shark can survive in both freshwater and saltwater?
What type of skeleton do sharks have?
Which species is known for the largest recorded shark bite?

name: World War II
description: Test your knowledge of major events, leaders, and facts from World War II.

questions.title: In which year did World War II begin?
Which countries made up the Axis Powers at the start of the war?
Which event led the United States to enter World War II?
Which leader served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom for most of the war?
What was the codename for the Allied invasion of Normandy in 1944?
Which battle is considered the turning point on the Eastern Front?
Which country was invaded first by Germany in 1939?
What was the name of the German air force during World War II?
Which conference in 1945 planned the postwar reorganization of Europe?
Which cities were hit by atomic bombs in 1945?

name: Computer Science
description: Test your knowledge of fundamental computer science concepts, history, and terminology.

questions.title: What does CPU stand for?
Which data structure uses the First-In, First-Out (FIFO) principle?
Which of the following is a non-volatile type of memory?
Who is known as the father of computer science?
What does HTML primarily define?

Which number system uses only 0 and 1?
Which programming language is mainly used for statistical computing?
What does ‘O’ represent in Big-O notation?
Which device converts digital signals into analog signals for transmission?

name: 80s Pop Legends
description: Test your knowledge of the biggest pop icons and hit-makers of the 1980s.

questions.title: Which Michael Jackson album became the best-selling album of all time?
Which Swedish group is known for hits like 'Dancing Queen' and 'Take a Chance on Me'?

options.text: Girls Just Want to Have Fun

questions.title: Phil Collins was the drummer and lead vocalist for which band during the 80s?

questions.title: What is the largest organ in the human body?
